definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: It is characterized by a return of peristalsis .
sentences.chinese: 它的特点是肠蠕动恢复。

sentences.english: Can you explain the reasons why eating lots of fruits and vegetables causes frequent bowel movements?
sentences.chinese: 为何食用过多的蔬菜水果会引起频繁的肠蠕动呢？

sentences.english: Conclusion Prunus armeniaca L can evidently relieve cough and improve the peristalsis of the large intestine.
sentences.chinese: 结论杏仁液有明显的止咳作用和增强大肠蠕动的作用。

sentences.english: Prevent fat accumulation, the two-day keep practicing yoga can promote peristalsis-type stand.
sentences.chinese: 天坚持练习两式站立瑜伽能够促进肠蠕动。

sentences.english: Increased pressure inside the abdomen, caused by constipation and the straining to pass a bowel motion, may also cause haemorrhoids .
sentences.chinese: 由便秘或紧张的肠蠕动引起的腹部高压可以引起痔疮。

sentences.english: In the irritable bowel syndrome peristalsis is stronger and more frequent than normal.
sentences.chinese: 在肠易激综合征肠蠕动，是更强大和更频繁的较正常。

sentences.english: Objective To summarize the effects of Danshen(Salvia Miltiorrhiza) Compound Injection on small intestinal peristalsis of mice.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究复方丹参注射液对小鼠小肠蠕动的影响。

sentences.english: Touching could facilitate the neonates' peristalsis, increase meconium excretion and decrease jaundice index.
sentences.chinese: 增加新生儿肠蠕动，促进胎粪排泄，降低黄疸指数。

definition: to drain (factory waste etc)/to excrete (urine, sweat etc)
